title-group.subtitle: Change Among High-Risk Sex Offenders

body.p: We invite submissions for a special issue of Sexual Abuse on change among high-risk sex offenders. Research has allowed evaluators to identify sex offenders who are at high risk for recidivism, but relatively little is known about how this risk can be reduced and how to assess such changes. This special issue will examine key issues regarding change among high-risk sex offenders and identify important directions for future research. Topics of interest include—but are not limited to—the mutability/immutability of high-risk status, mechanisms responsible for decreased risk, assessment of relevant change, and effectiveness of interventions for high-risk sex offenders.

The deadline for submissions is September 1, 2012. This special issue will be guest edited by Drs. Kevin Nunes and Michael Seto. All submissions will undergo full peer review before any acceptance for publication.

Manuscripts should be submitted electronically to the website at http://mc.manuscriptcentral.com/sajrt. The cover letter submitted with your manuscript must indicate that the submission is for this special issue.
Questions about the special issue can be addressed to Dr. Kevin L. Nunes at kevin_nunes@carleton.ca or Dr. Michael C. Seto at michael.seto@theroyal.ca.
